016package edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.service;
017
018import android.content.Context;
019import android.content.SharedPreferences;
020import androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;
021import androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData;
022import androidx.lifecycle.Transformations;
023import androidx.preference.PreferenceManager;
024import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
025import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.R;
026import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.controller.SettingsFragment;
027import javax.inject.Inject;
028import javax.inject.Singleton;
029import kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1;
030
031/**
032 * Implements a {@link LiveData}-based repository of preferences. It does not provide any preference
033 * mutation methods, and is of most use when all preferences are being modified through user
034 * interaction with an instance of a {@link androidx.preference.PreferenceFragmentCompat} subclass
035 * (such as {@link SettingsFragment}).
036 */
037@Singleton
038public class PreferencesRepository {
039
040  private final MutableLiveData<SharedPreferences> preferences;
041  private final LiveData<String> sportPreference;
042  private final LiveData<String> leaguePreference;
043  private final SharedPreferences prefs;
044
045  @Inject
046  PreferencesRepository(@ApplicationContext Context context) {
047    prefs = PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences(context);
048    preferences = new MutableLiveData<>(prefs);
049    String sportKey = context.getString(R.string.sport_key);
050    String leagueKey = context.getString(R.string.league_key);
051    sportPreference = Transformations.map(preferences, (prefs) -> this.prefs.getString(sportKey, ""));
052    leaguePreference = Transformations.map(preferences, (prefs) -> this.prefs.getString(leagueKey, ""));
053    prefs.registerOnSharedPreferenceChangeListener((prefs, key) -> preferences.postValue(prefs));
054  }
055
056  /**
057   * Returns {@link LiveData} of all shared preferences that have been set in application code or by
058   * the user in a {@link androidx.preference.PreferenceFragmentCompat} subclass instance. A
059   * viewmodel should then use {@link androidx.lifecycle.Transformations#map(LiveData, Function1)}
060   * (or a similar mechanism) to map the entire {@link SharedPreferences} instance in the
061   * {@link LiveData} returned by this method to {@link LiveData} fields for individual
062   * preferences.
063   */
064  public LiveData<SharedPreferences> getPreferences() {
065    return preferences;
066  }
067
068  public LiveData<String> getSportPreference() {
069    return sportPreference;
070  }
071
072  public LiveData<String> getLeaguePreference() {
073    return leaguePreference;
074  }
075
076  /**
077   * Utility method to allow pass-through read access to the underlying {@link SharedPreferences},
078   * by key. The compiler will infer the type parameter {@code T} by examining the
079   * {@code defaultValue} and the reference type of the assignment target (if any); if the inferred
080   * type is not one supported as a Shared
081   * @param key
082   * @param defaultValue
083   * @return
084   * @param <T>
085   */
086  public <T> T get(String key, T defaultValue) {
087    //noinspection unchecked
088    T result = (T) prefs.getAll().get(key);
089    return (result != null) ? result : defaultValue;
090  }
091
092
093}
